DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalized Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to completion of laboratory testing a sample by system established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalized Ratio Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to completion of laboratory testing a sample by system established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: System established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation tests. Under this system, results are standardized using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A system, commonly called the INR, established by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting) tests. All results are standardized using the international sensitivity index (ISI) for the particular thromboplastin reagent and instrument combination utilized to perform the test; the ratio of a patient's clotting time to the lab's mean reference value is normalized against the ISI. (from medterms.com and medicine.ucsf.edu)
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
